_header: Thou be wise dread thine own conscience
_description: One stanza rhyme royal, perhaps a draft of a poem or quotation, with corrections

BodAsh59.First Lines:
Thow be wys dred thi nowne consyens[ ]thanne the presens of eny
                    creatureyf thow haue [ ] god in reuerans[ ]thee of deth þou mayst
                    be sure…
BodAsh59.Last Lines:
…the [ ] yf þou lyste [ ] may flee[ ] sylf ye may
                    þer not parde
BodAsh59.Note:
The beginnings of lines are partly unreadable, because the folio is
                    damaged; the text has cancellations and corrections.
